item.text: This is the account of Noah’s sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.
The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

The <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="01586" class="">Gomer</st> were<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0813" class="">Ashkenaz</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="07384" class="">Riphath</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="08425" class="">Togarmah</st>.<n id="4" />

The <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="03120" class="">Javan</st> were <st data-num="0473" class="">Elishah</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08659" class="">Tarshish</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="03794" class="">Kittim</st>,<n id="3" /> and the <st data-num="01721" class="">Dodanim</st>.<n id="4" />
From these the coastlands of the nations were separated into their lands, every one according to its language, according to their families, by their nations.
The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.
Cush was the father of Nimrod; he began to be a valiant warrior on the earth.
He was a mighty hunter before the Lord. (That is why it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before the Lord.”)

The <st data-num="07225" class="">primary regions</st><n id="1" /> of his <st data-num="04467" class="">kingdom</st> were <st data-num="0894" class="">Babel</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0751" class="">Erech</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0390" class="">Akkad</st>,<n id="4" /> and <st data-num="03641" class="">Calneh</st><n id="5" /> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="08152" class="">Shinar</st>.<n id="6" />

<st data-num="04480" class="">From</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> he <st data-num="03318" class="">went</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>,<n id="2" /> where he <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> <st data-num="05210" class="">Nineveh</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="07344" class="">Rehoboth</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">Ir</st>,<n id="4" /> <st data-num="03625" class="">Calah</st>,<n id="5" />
and Resen, which is between Nineveh and the great city Calah.
Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
Pathrusites, Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and Caphtorites.
Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, Heth,
the <st data-num="02983" class="">Jebusites</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="01622" class="">Girgashites</st>,<n id="3" />
<st data-num="02340" class="">Hivites</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06208" class="">Arkites</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="05513" class="">Sinites</st>,<n id="3" />

<st data-num="0721" class="">Arvadites</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06786" class="">Zemarites</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="02577" class="">Hamathites</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0310" class="">Eventually</st> the <st data-num="04940" class="">families</st> of the <st data-num="03669" class="">Canaanites</st> were <st data-num="06327" class="">scattered</st>

and the <st data-num="01366" class="">borders</st> of <st data-num="03669" class="">Canaan</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">extended</st><n id="1" /> from <st data-num="06721" class="">Sidon</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0935" class="">all the way</st> to<n id="3" /> <st data-num="01642" class="">Gerar</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> <st data-num="05804" class="">Gaza</st>, and <st data-num="0935" class="">all the way</st> to<n id="4" /> <st data-num="05467" class="">Sodom</st>, <st data-num="06017" class="">Gomorrah</st>, <st data-num="0126" class="">Admah</st>, and <st data-num="06636" class="">Zeboyim</st>, <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> <st data-num="03962" class="">Lasha</st>.
These are the sons of Ham, according to their families, according to their languages, by their lands, and by their nations.
And sons were also born to Shem (the older brother of Japheth), the father of all the sons of Eber.
The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.

The <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="0758" class="">Aram</st> were <st data-num="05780" class="">Uz</st>, <st data-num="02343" class="">Hul</st>, <st data-num="01666" class="">Gether</st>, and <st data-num="04851" class="">Mash</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="0775" class="">Arphaxad</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">was the father of</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07974" class="">Shelah</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07974" class="">Shelah</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">was the father of</st> <st data-num="05677" class="">Eber</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="08147" class="">Two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> were <st data-num="03205" class="">born</st> to <st data-num="05677" class="">Eber</st>: <st data-num="0259" class="">One</st> was <st data-num="08034" class="">named</st> <st data-num="06389" class="">Peleg</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> in his <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> was <st data-num="06385" class="">divided</st>,<n id="1" /> and his <st data-num="0251" class="">brother’s</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> was <st data-num="03355" class="">Joktan</st>.

<st data-num="03355" class="">Joktan</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">was the father of</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0486" class="">Almodad</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="08026" class="">Sheleph</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="02700" class="">Hazarmaveth</st>,<n id="4" /> <st data-num="03392" class="">Jerah</st>,<n id="5" />
<st data-num="01913" class="">Hadoram</st>, <st data-num="0187" class="">Uzal</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01853" class="">Diklah</st>,<n id="2" />
<st data-num="05745" class="">Obal</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="039" class="">Abimael</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="07614" class="">Sheba</st>,<n id="3" />

<st data-num="0211" class="">Ophir</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02341" class="">Havilah</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03103" class="">Jobab</st>. <st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> were <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="03355" class="">Joktan</st>.

Their <st data-num="04186" class="">dwelling place</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> from <st data-num="04852" class="">Mesha</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">all the way</st> to<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05611" class="">Sephar</st> in the <st data-num="06924" class="">eastern</st> <st data-num="02022" class="">hills</st>.
These are the sons of Shem according to their families, according to their languages, by their lands, and according to their nations.
These are the families of the sons of Noah, according to their genealogies, by their nations, and from these the nations spread over the earth after the flood.
